trans-unit.source:
Thank you for taking the time (~10 minutes) to respond to this survey!

Some students who you teach are participating in a research project studying how children learn and develop. Your responses in this survey should apply to your classroom, school, and professional beliefs rather than to any one specific child.

This survey has two parts: Part A and Part B.

In Part A, the questions relate to your background and beliefs.

In Part B the questions are classroom specific. If you teach more than one class of students included in this project, you will complete Part B separately for each classroom.

If you teach a single subject, please complete the questions that relate to other subjects to the best of your knowledge or consult with a colleague for those details only.

Thank you for your participation! Your responses provide invaluable insight into the education of your students.

When you are ready to begin, select the “Start Survey” button.

Thank you!
trans-unit.target:
Thank you for taking the time (~10 minutes) to respond to this survey!

Some students who you teach are participating in a research project studying how children learn and develop. Your responses in this survey should apply to your classroom, school, and professional beliefs rather than to any one specific child.

This survey has two parts: Part A and Part B.

In Part A, the questions relate to your background and beliefs.

In Part B the questions are classroom specific. If you teach more than one class of students included in this project, you will complete Part B separately for each classroom.

If you teach a single subject, please complete the questions that relate to other subjects to the best of your knowledge or consult with a colleague for those details only.

Thank you for your participation! Your responses provide invaluable insight into the education of your students.

When you are ready to begin, select the "Start Survey" button.

Thank you!"

trans-unit.source: PART A: The following questions ask about your background, the school where you teach, your feelings about your job, and your beliefs about teaching and children.
trans-unit.target: PART A: The following questions ask about your background, the school where you teach, your feelings about your job, and your beliefs about teaching and children.

trans-unit.source: This set of questions asks about your background.
trans-unit.target: This set of questions asks about your background.

trans-unit.source: What is your current age?
What is your gender?
Other (please describe)

This set of questions asks about the school where you currently teach.
trans-unit.target: This group of questions explores the school you currently teach at.

trans-unit.source: Counting this school year, how many years have you been teaching at this school? (please round to the nearest year)
trans-unit.target: Including this school year, how many years have you taught at this school? (please round to the closest year)

trans-unit.source: Please indicate how much you agree or disagree with the following statements about this school.
trans-unit.target: Please state how much you agree or disagree with these statements about this school.

trans-unit.source: Strongly Disagree
Disagree
Agree
Strongly Agree
I feel accepted and respected as a colleague by most staff members.
trans-unit.target: I feel accepted and respected by most staff as a colleague.

trans-unit.source: Parents are supportive of school staff.
Students feel supported and comfortable in this school.
trans-unit.target: Students feel supported and comfortable in this school.

trans-unit.source: Staff feel supported and comfortable in this school.
trans-unit.target: Staff feel supported and comfortable in this school.

trans-unit.source: Students are safe when here at this school.
trans-unit.target: Students are safe in this school.

trans-unit.source: Staff are safe when here at this school.
trans-unit.target: Staff are safe in this school.

trans-unit.source: The facilities and property of this school are kept up well.
trans-unit.target: The school facilities and property are maintained well.

trans-unit.source: The facilities and property of this school are clean.
trans-unit.target: The school facilities and property are clean.

trans-unit.source: Ongoing collaboration is something adults in this school do well.
trans-unit.target: Adults in this school excel at ongoing collaboration.

trans-unit.source: Adults working in this school have strong professional relationships.
trans-unit.target: Adults working in this school form strong professional ties.

trans-unit.source: Adults working in this school are respectful and supportive of one another.
trans-unit.target: Adults in this school show respect and support for each other.

trans-unit.source: With this set of items, we wish to learn more about teachers' feelings about their job.
trans-unit.target: This section is to understand teachers' feelings about their job.

trans-unit.source: Please select one answer that indicates how often you agree with each of the following statements.
trans-unit.target: Select one answer to indicate how often you agree with each of the following statements.

trans-unit.source: A few times a year or less
trans-unit.target: A few times a year or less

trans-unit.source: Once a month or less
A few times a month
A few times a week
Everyday
I feel emotionally drained from my work.
trans-unit.target: I feel emotionally exhausted from my work.

trans-unit.source: I feel fatigued when I get up in the morning and have to face another day on the job.
trans-unit.target: I feel tired in the morning when I think of facing another workday.

trans-unit.source: I can easily understand how my students feel about things.
trans-unit.target: I easily empathize with students' feelings.

trans-unit.source: I deal very effectively with the problems of my students.
I feel burned out from my work.
trans-unit.target: I feel overwhelmed by my work.

trans-unit.source: I feel I'm positively influencing other people's lives through my work.
trans-unit.target: I feel I positively impact others' lives through my work.

trans-unit.source: I feel frustrated by my job.
I feel I'm working too hard on my job.
trans-unit.target: I work too hard at my job.

trans-unit.source: I can easily create a relaxed atmosphere with my students.
trans-unit.target: I can easily create a relaxed environment with my students.

trans-unit.source: I feel exhilarated after working closely with my students.
trans-unit.target: I feel invigorated after closely working with my students.

trans-unit.source: I have accomplished many worthwhile things in this job.
trans-unit.target: I've achieved many meaningful accomplishments in this job.

trans-unit.source: I feel like I'm at the end of my rope.
In my work, I deal with emotional problems very calmly.
trans-unit.target: I manage emotional issues calmly in my job.

trans-unit.source: This set of questions is designed to help us gain a better understanding of the kinds of things that create difficulties for teachers in their school activities.
trans-unit.target: This set of questions helps us comprehend the challenges teachers face in their school activities.

trans-unit.source: How much influence do you have...
trans-unit.target: To what degree do you have influence on...

trans-unit.source: Very Little
Some Influence
Quite a Bit
A Great Deal
on disruptive behavior in the classroom?
to motivate children who show low interest in activities?
trans-unit.target: motivating children with low interests during activities?

trans-unit.source: to get children to believe they can do well on activities?
to help children in your classroom(s) value learning?
on getting children to follow classroom rules?
on calming a child who is disruptive or noisy?
How well can you...
trans-unit.target: How proficient are you in the following...

trans-unit.source: Not At All
Very Little
Somewhat
Quite a Bit
A Great Deal
establish a classroom management system?
use a variety of assessment strategies?
provide alternative explanations or examples when children are confused?
trans-unit.target: offering alternate explanations or examples for confused students?

trans-unit.source: assist families in helping their children do well in school?
trans-unit.target: collaborating with families to ensure children's academic success?

trans-unit.source: implement alternative strategies in your classroom(s)?
trans-unit.target: executing alternative strategies in your classrooms?

trans-unit.source: create good questions for children in your classroom(s)?
trans-unit.target: creating engaging questions for your students?

trans-unit.source: With this set of items, we wish to learn more about teachers' ideas and beliefs about children.
trans-unit.target: This item set explores teachers' perceptions and beliefs about children.

trans-unit.source: Please select one answer that indicates how strongly you agree with each of the following statements.
trans-unit.target: Select the option that reflects your agreement with the statements below.

trans-unit.source: Strongly Disagree
Mildly Disagree
Mildly Agree
Strongly Agree
Since parents lack special training in education, they should not question the teacher's teaching methods.
trans-unit.target: Because parents lack educational training, they should not question a teacher's methods.

trans-unit.source: Children should be treated the same regardless of differences among them.
trans-unit.target: Children should be treated equally, despite their differences.

trans-unit.source: Children should always obey the teacher.
trans-unit.target: Children should always obey the teacher.

trans-unit.source: Preparing for the future is more important for a child than enjoying today.
trans-unit.target: Preparing for the future takes precedence over current enjoyment for children.

trans-unit.source: Children will not do the right thing unless they must.
trans-unit.target: Children won't do the right thing unless made to do it.

trans-unit.source: Children should be allowed to disagree with their parents if they feel their own ideas are better.
trans-unit.target: Children can disagree with parents if they believe they have better ideas.

trans-unit.source: Children should be kept busy with work and study at home and at school.
trans-unit.target: Children should stay busy with work and studies both at home and at school.

trans-unit.source: The major goal of education is to put basic information into the minds of the children.
trans-unit.target: The main aim of education is to instill basic knowledge in children.

trans-unit.source: In order to be fair, a teacher must treat all children alike.
trans-unit.target: A teacher must treat all children fairly by treating them the same.

trans-unit.source: The most important thing to teach children is absolute obedience to whoever is in authority.
trans-unit.target: Absolute obedience to authority is vital to teach children.

trans-unit.source: Children learn best by doing things themselves rather than listening to others.
trans-unit.target: Children learn most effectively by doing activities themselves.

trans-unit.source: Children must be carefully trained early in life or their natural impulses will make them unmanageable.
trans-unit.target: Without early training, children's natural impulses will become unmanageable.

trans-unit.source: Children have a right to their own point of view and should be allowed to express it.
trans-unit.target: Children should have the freedom to express their viewpoints.

trans-unit.source: Children's learning results mainly from being presented basic information again and again.
trans-unit.target: Learning mainly stems from constant exposure to fundamental information.

trans-unit.source: Children like to teach other children.
The most important thing to teach children is absolute obedience to parents.
trans-unit.target: Instilling obedience to parents is the most crucial lesson for children.
